intro: Allium lasiophyllum, commonly known as the purple onion, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its striking purple or violet bulbils that form clusters on the stem, giving it a unique appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, white or pale pink flowers in late summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is a popular plant among gardeners.
